member.name: T:Elements.Serialization.JSON.SolidConverter
member.summary: The SolidConverter is used to serialize and deserialize a Solid. Solids have a self-referencing structure which does not serialize effectively using the default serialization logic. The SolidConverter serializes and deserializes starting at the Solid's Faces, using Vertex and Edge ids to reconstruct and link the Edges and Vertices as necessary.

member.name: T:Elements.Spatial.CellComplex.DirectedEdge
member.summary: A directed edge: a representation of a edge that has direction to it so that it can be used to traverse faces. This is essentially equivalent to the concept of a half edge, except it can be related to more than just a single Face. There is a maximum of two DirectedEdges per Edge. This class is completely internal and only used for utilities inside of CellComplex.

member.name: F:Elements.Spatial.CellComplex.DirectedEdge.EdgeId
member.summary: ID of the associated, direction-agnostic Edge.

member.name: M:Elements.Spatial.CellComplex.DirectedEdge.#ctor(Elements.Spatial.CellComplex.CellComplex,System.UInt64,Elements.Spatial.CellComplex.Edge,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Represents a unique DirectedEdge within a CellComplex. This is added in addition to Edge because the same line may be required to move in a different direction as we traverse the edges of a face in their correctly-wound order. Is not intended to be created or modified outside of the CellComplex class code.
member.param: CellComplex that this DirectedEdge belongs to.
The undirected Edge that matches this DirectedEdge
If true, start point is same as edge.StartVertexId. Otherwise, is flipped.

member.name: M:Elements.Spatial.Grid2d.GetTransformedOrigin
member.summary: This method finds the origin of the transformed 2d grid.
